chapter.label: Introduction
chapter.title: About
chapter.para: The Media Encoding CLuster is a Programm which can be used to Encode Media Files Distributed over Nodes that reduces the Encoding Time.

section.title: Why using Media Encoding Cluster
section.para: If you want to reduce Encoding Time per Media File!
If you want to Encode Files in a Batch!
If you want to have a Fault tollerant and allmost uptime Infrastructure for your Media Services!

section.title: Which Operting System for using Media Encoding Cluster
section.para: It is currently running under Windows XP, Linux, MacOsx 10.5

section.title: What do i need for running the Media Encoding Cluster
section.para: You need only the Download Package from http://codergrid.de

listitem.para: Windows XP with Service Pack 2
Linux
3.2GHz Intel® Pentium® 4 processor (dual Intel Xeon® or faster recommended)
2GB of RAM (4GB recommended)
1Gb Ethernet card

section.title: Installation on Windows XP
section.para: Double Click on "MediaEncodingCluster-Setup-X.X.X.X.exe", where "X.X.X.X" is the actual Version.
This will open the Welcome Screen from the Installer.

caption.para: After "next" Button clicked, you can enter the Target Diretory location for the Programm Installation.
Accept the default installation location or enter a new location.
Note, there must be enough Space Left for Temporary Encoded Data and the Encoded Files
Default Programm Group where the Tools are located in the Windows Programm Menu
Accept the default location for the Media Encoding Cluster program shortcuts or enter a new location.

listitem.para: Server System
System will be configured to autostart the Server as System Service
Client System
System will be configured to autostart the Client as System Service

caption.para: Review your installation choices. Click Back to make any necessary changes.
Note: On Windows, Microsoft Visual C++ 2008 Redistributable Package also installs.
you can start the Runtime System on the Node
Select any final options and click Finish. The installation is complete. If you configured it to start, Media Encoding Cluster starts.

section.para: After installation there is an new Service under the Windows Services called MHiveService
This Service will be automatically started when the System boots up.

chapter.title: Starting and Stopping the Server or Client
chapter.para: In condition to your Installation the Server and/or the Client starts automatical on the Node.
when you want to start or stop the Server and/or Client, you can do this over the Console

listitem.para: Open the Console over the Startmenu from Windows "Start->Programs->MediaEncodingCluster->start Console"
Type in the Command "startserver()." <- dont forget the dot at the end ->
This starts the Server on the Local Maschine
Type in the Command "stopserver()." <- dont forget the dot at the end ->
This stops the Server on the Local Maschine
Type in the Command "startclient("Host")." <- dont forget the dot at the end ->
This Command will connect to the Server Maschine defined by "Host" and start the Client Process on the Local Maschine
Type in the Command "stopclient()." <- dont forget the dot at the end ->
This will stop the Local Client Process

chapter.para: after you have started or stopped the System, you can close the Console.
